term.title: Michaelis–Menten mechanism

item.text: The Michaelis–Menten mechanism is the simplest mechanism that will explain Michaelis–Menten kinetics According to the mechanism, a substrate A first combines with a molecule of enzyme E, and this process is followed by a step in which the enzyme-substrate complex EA breaks down (sometimes with the participation of the solvent) into enzyme and reaction products: E + A (k1)⇌(k-1) EA (k2)→ E + Products is the total concentration of enzyme. This equation is of the form of the Michaelis–Menten equation. Other, more complicated, mechanisms lead to the Michaelis–Menten equation, adherence to which therefore does not require that the Michaelis– Menten mechanism applies.

item.alttext: v = k 2 E 0 A k-1 + k 2 k 1 + A
